data.title: Fun comedy spot!
data.text:
This club is doing everything right. The staff is polite, efficient, and accommodating. One of the waitresses in particular was such a sweetheart - she made the extra effort to help with some dietary needs in my party and not only nailed it, but remembered us the next time we came in so we didn't have to go through the whole explanation again.

The shows I've seen there have been really hilarious, including the opening comedians. The food is surprisingly good, as are their specialty cocktails. I think my biggest complaint is that the women's bathroom is definitely not big enough, so make sure you go before the end of the show or you'll be in line for days.

data.title: A fun time!
data.text: Went for the first time last Sunday.  Easy street parking right in front, quick food and drink service.  Drinks were great, food was nothing special but that's fine.  They had a few openers and then the main act.  We got a picture with him afterwards.  It was a fun time and I've already bought tickets to another show!

data.title: Best Kept Secret in Tacoma and Puget Sound
data.text: We (my wife and friends) have been coming here for a few years now.  Love the atmosphere, not too small and not too big.  Great headliners, very reasonable prices for tickets, great staff, and location is good, plenty of street parking and restaurants in the area.  But their food is good too.

data.title: No Fun
data.text: Portland comedy clubs much better. I do not recommend this place for a evening of fun with friends. Definitely a waste of time

data.title: Nice place, nice service
data.text: Saw Ron funches here.  Had to drive from seattle, so it took over an hour to get there.  Had free street parking right across the street from the front door.  Lots of it! (It was on a Thursday at 6:30pm). Club is large and open, with a high ceiling.  You can see the stage from just about everywhere. The hostesses and servers were all very welcoming and courteous. I didn't eat, but what I saw looked good.  I only had beer, so I can't speak about the cocktails.  The warm up acts were pretty ok.  I see they're attracting some known acts, so they're doing something right! We had a great time, and I think it's worth the trip to go again.

data.title: Jokes on You
data.text:
Great place, so long as you don't have any issues. If you do have issues, don't bother bringing it up to them, they truly don't care; and even take the opportunity to express just how little they care by getting completely unnecessarily catty with you. The image attached is the real email thread, no edits except blocking out help-a-stalker type info. I apologize for the terrible spelling in the beginning (phone typing versus keyboard typing later).

I oh-so-rarely ask for a company to help me out, especially when I'm clearly the idiot. I left my ID at home, that's on me. I understood the policy preventing me from getting in without an ID, I didn't argue it, I wasn't mean about it, I was just bummed out and mad at myself. It was a 40 minute drive (one-way), stand in line, get to the front, so close to putting a bad day behind me with a laughter-is-the-best-medicine attitude and a show I was really looking forward to, and... nope, I picked that night to be human, aka fallible. I didn't ask for the ticket transfer for the financial aspect, the ticket was only $20. I think more than anything I was hoping for an exchange so I wouldn't be so mad at myself. And I guess I thought I wasn't asking for the moon seeing as I had already paid the money, I was just hoping to use it on another night since I couldn't get in that night. It's a fairly common request that many other businesses have figured out how to honor, yes, including "movies and theater events." Another thing other businesses have figured out how to do is just be nice, treat your customer base with some kindness and understanding. Pointing blame at me, telling me how it's all my fault and I have no right to ask for anything, then going into how much meaner you could get with me if you so chose, is the type of response I might expect from a close friend... with severe blame issues... who was having a really bad day herself, or perhaps an angry ex, or even, dare say, my mother; but from a professional business? There was absolutely no need to get so defensive and aggressive. An All Sales Final policy is not some concrete law mandated by the state that you are so powerless against you can't even act like you have a heart.

Now I know that me never going there again isn't going to hurt their bottom line, and there are plenty of other, better comedy clubs that I enjoy and can spend my money at, so neither of us are going to miss each other in this break up. But I just wanted to put it out there, businesses are only open because of the people who spend their money to keep it open, and those people should be cared about. If you truly cannot do anything to help them out, you can at least be nice about it, a little sympathetic, or just, you know, professional.

But, that's just one fallible human's opinion.

data.title: Lots of Fun
data.text: First time at this comedy club. Lots of room and wait staff. Great atmosphere and comedy.  Very comparable to other clubs around the area and country. Would recommend for anyone who loves to laugh. No parking issues which are close by.

data.title: Lots of laughs!
data.text:
We got to meet one of our comic heroes! 
D L Hugley always great times and lots of laughed. If you wait till the end of the show you can meet the comedians. I recommend you check it and sign up for free birthday tickets at the Tacoma Comedy Club Cheers!

data.title: It's a great secret
data.text:
OK, been going here for at least four years and have loved just about every single show.  It's not too big that you can't see the entertainer and not so small that they are forced to cram you in like sardines.  Have seen some big names here, Christopher Titus, Ralphie May, and Joe Koy among others.  

The one down side is their beer.  I have had it happen several times to me and their beer comes out flat or very bitter.  The service is either spot on or lousy, but more often right on.  You want to get there early as seating is first come first serve, unless you buy the VIP tickets.   Also, sign up for their mailing list and you will receive FREE tickets throughout the year and for your birthday.  Even if it's not for a big name, its a cheap night out and it only costs you your drinks.  

They have started a two item minimum, but honestly, still not a deal breaker.  Their food and booze prices are not over the top.  Parking is not horrible, but you might have to drive around the block.

data.title: Have some fun in Tacoma
data.text: While not a "upscale" venue, this place is comfortable.  It looks like a bar and grill inside because that is really what it started out as.  But, it's now a complete comedy club with some of the best in the nation dropping in for a show.  Most of the good ones not only go to Seattle, but now they come here too.  Some only come here.  Keep and eye on the ads and their web site to see who is appearing if you are looking for a name, but we have seen some really good stuff from unknowns here. It's becoming a place to see the up and coming stars.  Food and drinks are nothing special, but it's always fun here.

data.title: Great comedy - bad environment
data.text: The comedians are funny and it is fun to watch them BUT you can not talk to anyone at your table.  Make that you can not even turn and jointly laugh with them about the show.  Seriously the staff is ridiculously overbearing and aggressive towards people that are laughing and having a good time.  Not a fun environment.  Our group was asked not to talk even though we were whispering. Really a comedy club where you sit primly in your seat and laugh politely - no talking?  Will not be going back.

data.title: Wonderful Local Club Brings National Acts
data.text:
We are so fortunate to have Tacoma Comedy Club in the downtown core.  TCC brings high calibre comedians to Tacoma for reasonable prices...last night we saw Bobcat Goldthwait and our VIP tickets were less than thirty dollars apiece.  (Shout out to Bobcat:  I LOVE YOU!  Thanks for the great evening!)

Other comedians like Jon Lovitz, DL Hughley, Gilbert Godfried and Pablo Francisco have been here as well.  It's definitely worth your time to keep an eye on their calendar if you're into stand up!

The staging area is intimate, so it's one of those venues where the comedians are more likely to interact with the audience than a big hall.  It's pretty comfortable and the acoustics are very good.  Drinks are ok...I haven't tried the food, but table mates always like their food and it is reasonably priced.

data.title: Fun Saturday night entertainment.
data.text: Nice place.  Clean, customer friendly wait staff.  Good Comedians to watch.  There is very good security in the house too.

data.title: Great show and staff
data.text: Went to see a comedy show it was fantastic. The staff was friendly and at check in very organized. Going to the comedy club is a great way to spend an evening.

data.title: Good late night entertainment option
data.text:
I came here with a group of friends for a birthday. I ended up having a great time! The comedians were legitimately funny, even the openers were hilarious. Lots of laughs all around. I would come back again for a date night.

I like that they don't allow heckling during the show. 

The food was quite good(had a burger)! I wasn't expecting that for a comedy club. There did seem to be some confusion during food service about which table ordered what, not just with my order, but with other people in the group. The staff made it right, though.

data.title: Jacked up bouncer on steroids "what a DICK"
data.text: Group of six went to mo mandel had a geat time enjoying  ourselfs laughing next thing you know the jacked up bald bouncer on steroids came over and asked us to keep it down....seriously it's a comedy club next thing you know I was talking with two waitresses and 1 guy clearing tables talked to all 3 and told them what happened they said he does it all the time to people.. I said really. I went to the bouncer him self and said something next thing you know he puffs up his chest at meall I could do was laugh that was the funniest thing that happened all night we more than likely will not be back

data.title: Bar none the best comedy club I have been to in the country
data.text:
As a performer, I have been to hundreds of comedy clubs around the country and none are as professional and well run as Tacoma Comedy Club.

Beyond that, they are the best booked comedy club in the country for the value. For only $15 a show, you can see the absolute best headlining comedians in the country - some you have heard of and some you have not. Additionally, they have a pool of hosts and openers that are excellent and worth the $15 themselves. 

Finally, the food and drinks are not just good for a comedy club but good for any bar or restaurant you'll ever go to.

data.title: Affordable Fun
data.text: I was a little skeptical about going to a comedy club but I am so glad that we went! I had never been to a comedy club before and I spent the entire night laughing my head off. It was so much fun and the staff was very helpful. I felt like we were well attended to without feeling hounded for more food or drinks. I would definitely recommend going to a show because it was an awesome change in my normal nightly plans!

data.title: Fun Times in Tacoma!
data.text:
Their staff does a good job serving guests and prices are reasonable. They maintain an orderly setting which is much appreciated by our group. There is a good selection of comedians and plenty of freebies offered compared to other local venues.
We recommend checking them out and getting signed up on their e-mail list.

Way To Go, Tacoma Comedy Club!

data.title: Affordable laughs
data.text: My daughter bought us tickets to the comedy club for my birthday, what a wonderful gift. It has been years since I went to a live comedy club and this was no disappointment. Deceivingly large and well ventilated building with good seating, a full service bar, and a pretty good "bar food" menu. Very affordable tickets with many mid to upper tier comedians. Typical shows run about 1 1/2 hours with an 8 pm and 10 pm showings. No bad seats in the house and tables right next to the stage, if you are there early, at no extra cost. The lighting and sound system was prefect for the size of the room and didn't over power the audience. Decent parking available around the area for reasonable prices or there is some street parking available as well. Wide choice of acts that you are sure to find somebody to suit your taste. Great affordable way to spend a Saturday evening!
